intro: Hoffmannseggia ternata, commonly known as the three-lobed stonecress, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb with succulent, fleshy leaves that are adapted to conserve water. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous and helps it survive in poor soil conditions. Hoffmannseggia ternata is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, making it a characteristic species of its native environment.
